Chris, thanks for the suggestion.  Actually we are using Torque right
now, but the problem is Torque is not really geared towards RTS-style
games.  Torque was designed for first-person shooter type play.  That
is not to say it can't be made more RTS-like, but in the long run it
has issues that make it would be better to have something that was
designed for the right type of perspective.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Chris Christenson <cc57@t...> wrote:
> Take a look at Torque.
> 
> http://www.garagegames.com/
> 
> the engine was designed for a fps. But I have worked with it some
and
> there is a huge community that uses it and provides code to that
website
> for other users.  It is not limited to fps.
> 
> -Chris
>

wrote:
> > As some of you know, we are working on a game here that uses NEAT
as
> > its core AI.  We have a graphical game engine that is working for
us
> > for now, but we are starting to think more long-term about the
right
> > engine for the future.  I wonder if anyone here knows any way to 
> > license or obtain an RTS-style game engine from any company or
> > organization?  There are several first-person-shooter style
engines
> > available, but it's much harder to find an RTS engine.  Any
> > suggestions would be apprecated!
> > 
> > ken
